comments.body: Please add an expectation - when the cat eats, you cannot give it any more for some time!

Minecraft users should have the ability to pick up cats by pressing a button on the bottom of their screen if they don‚Äôt  have anything in their hand and off hand, or pet their cats if they don‚Äôt have anything in their hand by pressing another button. This should be in Minecraft because some people don‚Äôt have cats and can‚Äôt do any of that so they should at least get to do it on Minecraft .
It would be amazing! i hope mojang sees this!
Awesome idea!
sounds amazing
I love cats, and Minecraft doesn't do them well enough, I think this is a great idea
I agree with adding Tucans into the game. Because they are cute and make great pets.
I want this.

This, I just tamed a wolf and it keep barking for no reason.
This would be sooo amazing! Please make this happen!!!
Actually it's their choice we have a trident to this game it's greek mythology -_-
Votei
Bom
Capivaraaaaaaaas
How does this make sense. They are not zombies why would the scars be green if they are not zombies. Why did you vote for this???????
Makes sense, but I think the green is just the Zombified Piglin's flesh rotting.
Why just piglin brutes also  the piglin brutes are not zombified also im pretty sure this category is for bugs with thhe beates
I fear there is a bit of, conflict of interest with the existence of this mob. Wolfs chase skeletons for there bones, these Wolfs are skeletons, why would they not chase eachother in the same way?

Skeleton wolves are in Minecraft Earth.
But Minecraft Earth is running out, so it should be added to the original Minecraft.
They should spawn in the Soul Sand Valley biome and in the ordinary world, but only during a full moon.
They would have the same mechanics as in Minecraft Earth and it would be impossible to tame them.
Connor Schultz, I think like this: normal wolves would attracted to solid cruncy bones, while skeleton wolves would attracted to fresh juicy living creature's meat. Sounds make sense

I like it, but I'm confused about the whole "skeleton wolf killing your dog" thing.  It seems like in order to get a tamed skeleton wolf, you must force your doggy to get killed by a skeleton wolf... doesn't make the most sense.  I think maybe it should be a situation similar to the skeleton horse, where the skeleton wolves have skeleton owners and you have to kill their owners without killing the wolves themselves, and then you have a pet... or something like that.  The Nether skeleton wolves should be wither skeleton wolves.
Really terrifying but cool and creative idea

Skeleton wolves are my favorite Minecraft Earth mob, and I hope it gets added to vanilla Minecraft! It could be a hostile mob in the Nether's Soul Sand Valley, and can spawn rarely in the overworld during new moon nights. It should be tameable like normal wolves, making it the first tameable hostile mob!
If lightening strikes a wolf or a tamed wolf it will create a skeleton wolf.
cool idea

With the new wolf variants in today's snapshot, this is the perfect time to add Skeleton Wolves from Minecraft Earth! I think they could spawn whenever lightning strikes a wolf of any variant, or be a Nether exclusive wolf variant. They should be hostile, like MCE, but be tameable if not attacked and fed enough raw meat/rotten flesh (not cooked meat!). It could pose a unique challenge to players that want every variant, with the need to tame a mob that is aggressive.

Love the idea of skeleton wolves. Think it might be nice is the spawned in the soul sand valley in the nether or when a regular wolf wolf is struck by lightning. They would be hostile until tamed and work similar to skeleton horses (don‚Äôt burn in sunlight and can walk/run around on the ocean floor or in water and be immune to drowning)

Would love there to be a rare wither skeleton wolf that you get by breeding 2 skeleton wolves at a nether fortress. This wither wolf will give the wither effect to creatures it attacks and will be immune to fire and lava damage because it is a nether mob.

Both types of wolf would be marked as undead mobs (meaning they are healed by harming potions and harmed by healing ones)

I think adding these two new skeleton wolf types would make the game more interesting and add more reason to want wolves. Plus lots of people like collecting mobs and this would add two new undead ones. Also I would love to create Grimm from Dantdm in vanilla and I have wanted a lava proof dog for ages.

If this feels like too much to add minecraft could just make the skeletal wolf a cosmetic thing (like the toast name tag on rabbits) where if you name a wolf or dog ‚ÄúGrimm‚Äù it becomes a skeletal version.

Just my ideas on this.

I think they should only spawn in the soul sand valley naturally or if a wolf gets struck by lightning, not that regular wolves that get killed turn into them.

I do think though that there should be a zombie wolf that you can tame and your wolf can become zombified if they are attacked by another zombie wolf. You should be able to heal them just like villagers though so you can turn them back if you don't want them undead. And maybe if they do turn you would have to tame them again if you wanted to keep them as a zombie.

One thing that I think would balance this is if tamed wolves protect whatever livestock and cats you have tamed or bred, vs zombie or skeleton wolves will attack your livestock so you would have to keep them separated from your other pets and your farms.
Here‚Äôs an idea, it disguised as coral blocks, and if you break a nearby coral block or other coral variants, it‚Äôs tail whips you with its tail then bites you
Ocelots already do this but the new cats in 1.14 should attack parrots and chickens.
Define normal penguins. Other than that, great idea!
Like wolves and cats we should be able to have them as pets

To give them a use beyond just being another piece of oversized ambience (ambient mobs seem more fitting around the size of a bat to me), they could be turned into temporary helpers with bucketed fish (similar to how dolphins aren't tamed, but can lead you to shipwrecks in exchange for fish) to then assist when the player goes fishing, doing their own fishing dives near the fishing rod's bobber.
I think there should be many penguin variants based on real penguin species.
Le dieran la ambientaci√≥n medieval a los biomas del artico muy buena idea.
Wouldn't it make more sense to put them in the swamp?
a capybara? you're kidding, she's so small that it would be silly to add her - no one will literally notice her.
Y E S (:
Super pomys≈Çüí≠

In nature, capybaras run away from ocelots, you can implement this in the game.
How about adding a benefit to them?
They could gnaw a tree that grows nearby. It would become hewn, and then it would turn into a new block/fuel for the furnace.
I apologize for my English.
GOOD IDEA
totally agree, right now bat's are useless it would be cool to have them do something. Maybe they would swarm hostile mobs, or if you wack them they bit you?
They could drop a substance so that you could make night vision
they should drop gunpowder every 5-10 minutes like chickens. also :'(
There could be guano deposits from bats in caves which would be used to make fertilizer.
This makes me on the bridge of crying every time I read this.
This is the very right time to update the bats along with the cave

I also agree that bats should get an update and maybe more of a use as would benefit perfectly from it during this update! A couple of ideas I added to was from this post!

Please vote it higher for better bat AI and hopefully a new cave biome! 

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077154731-Guano-Caves

some specific mechanics i've thought of are;

bats hunt arthropods (siders, cave spiders, silverfish, and bees) helping the player out with surviving underground.  to protect your bees from bat attacks, place some berry vines/bushes near the hive to distract them. 

bats hunt spiders for their eyes, which they eat, giving us a non player based method of gathering spider eyes. (if you manage to wrangle up one)

bats pick and eat berries allowing for tall glowberry farms, and they pick up and eat apples, golden apples, melon slices, and glistening melons.
I totally agree, they could atleast give bats some of the same abilities as birds.
bats need a update.
I had the idea of bats pollinating Glowberries like Bees do for other plants. Thoughts?

I love the nectar idea! The bats in Minecraft look like some species of North American Microbat while eat insects, and while it would make my entire year for Mojang to add more types of bats (my fav animal) so an Australian fruit bat can eat nectar, I'm not sure if they would do it so having them get nectar from the lush caves and insects from fireflies is a good idea. 

What about echolocation? Bats in caves may be drawn towards structures and ores with a high chance of coal or iron and a lower chance of diamonds or gold. It would be nice to give them a purpose since everyone I play with gets annoyed by the squeaking and kills them.

Bats flying over crops or sculks (seems they hinted it was some sort of organism) increases grow speed, which then you also get bat boxes. Naturally, they only fly at night to fertilize, giving them a use and potentially encouraging people to build real bat boxes.

YESSSS i agree, but maybe add some help with them. perhaps they should also have an enemy mob (phantoms?). and i saw how u flew in the cave with your elytra...what if bats gave you a boost? they all fly around you while youre in flight! and maybe add color variations.
Bats should also be tamed using fruit and they should be able to find ores for you using echolocation since they use echolocation in real life

i feel that bats could target the already existing bugs in Minecraft (spiders, cave spiders, silverfish, and bees) as a new farm mechanic.  they could be used for a non-player powered spider eye farm.  in order to defend your bee hives from bat attacks, you could set up glowberry vines or sweet berry bushes as a distraction.  
Many real world bats eat fruit, so having them eat berries, like foxes, as well as apples and melon slices would be cool too.  right now, glowberry farms are stuck as one block tall, but with bats, you could bring them into the 3rd dimension.
This looks pretty good so far. Prehaps they can be given a more slow deliberate flight and made so they don't fly into lava accidentally.

I think bats should have a day/night cycle. At night, they pathfind to the surface to hunt, during the day they pathfind to the caves to sleep. This can add atmosphere but also give players a sense of time underground and possible help them find their way out of (or into) the caves.

and also different types like the Fox bats, Fruit bats, and/or Yoda bats. or maybe like the cats when they have variables when you tame them 

p.s. tamable with new fruits the mango!!
they should all fly out of the caves at night! also, they need a drop!
This would look especially awesome for the 1.18 update. Maybe a last addition before it's too late?
A new look and maybe tamable
Bats should be in packs 1-6. Bats should drop BAT wings, for use in either crafting leather products or potions.
Bats could drop guano (bone meal).
It should have an exclusive drop, like new weapons

@wyattisme10 We don't need more weapons in this update. Netherite is more than enough, don't you think? That's kind of the starring feature of the major upcoming update, adding another obscure weapon would take away from that...

@Lili5510 While I do believe we don't really need new weapons it would still be neat to have the Blighted drop an exclusive item. That's why I thought of the Crimson Rod; an item that turns Cows into Mooshrooms and burns objects or enemies. It's not very useful, but it's still a cool and neat item to get. However, I said possible, because it's up to the developers if they want to add the Crimson Rod as a new item.

@FrixForgotten I think it's time they add an actually useful mob drop. It would be cool if the crimson rod is a replacement for the stick for even better swords and/or tools(like maybe for new ingots and such). I'm kind of tired of getting purposeless items. Yes, netherite is cool and all but if people can beat the enderdragon and wither with diamond armor, I'm pretty sure they don't need another type. I wish they would just add some new bosses and at least one new dimension. The current bosses are too easy for diamond armor, let alone NETHERITE. So thats why its kinda not that exciting considering it doesnt help that much, so adding a bit more other than a new ingot would be cool.
It could be a new source of crimson fungus
Maybe there should be a blaze for every nether biome

Also, the different antelope variants could spawn in different biomes.

For example, Gemsbok and Thompson‚Äôs Gazelle could spawn in Savannahs, Oryxes in the deserts, Pronghorn in Plains biomes, Nigali in Jungle Biomes, and perhaps a colder species of antelope (Like the Saiga of siberian steppes) could spawn in Ice Plains.

Support, would love to see something like this added, especially following up on Doc's comment about the different types of antelopes in the biomes that could spawn, including things he already said like gazelles.

so i was going to post this till i say this one so im just going to put it here because its adds on a bit --> so with the mobs we have we just don't have the liveliness that some players including my self are looking for when roaming a forest so what if we had a bunch of mobs that just acted like other mobs just with new sounds and maybe a slightly modified loot table.
Yes please! More insects would be cool!

I think that this would be better than adding new animals that have a new use. It would give the feel of life everywhere but not make the game less minecrafty. My suggestion for the mobs is Birds, Fireflies, Flies(swamp), more bat spawning, and small lizards.
hola
Cool
I think Worms can be used as the moles feeding item, which can be found in random dirt blocks. These could also be useful for fishing and potions.

moles could be worked to add danger and potential reward. maybe make them volitile like endermen, yet befriendable to find structures, and they pathfind towards cave-like areas so you would have to manually strip mine a massive gap to attract them... and if you make it so they dont go down to the diamond layer that really could mix up underground exploration
It‚Äôs now the cliffs and caves update we need them now!
That's a mob for the Deep Dark, with the Warden

Idea: if killing one it will drop:

Maybe they drop claws and like shedding claws and can add to the pickaxe , so a buff +1 to digging speed max 5

Agreed. I honestly don't know why this still isn't a feature as there are already emotes in the bedrock editions.
Yeah I know right?????
Maybe petting could increase the pets health!
Minecraft is bast
When you pet your pet would your other pet walk next to you so it would be petted? Also can we belly-rub them please!

I think I can find out which golems have what stats:

Gold Golem - Very fast (the fastest one on this list!), but doesn't do a lot of damage, and doesn't have a lot of health. Also, Piglins would follow it around, allowing for the Gold Golem to kill those Piglins easier.

Redstone Golem - The most unique out of all of these, this one can jump really high in the air using the power of pistons to find its enemies! Also would be made with a redstone block in the middle and cobblestone for the body, but the carved pumpkin is still on as the head.

Diamond Golem - The second strongest, this one can almost one-hit. Also, this one is the second slowest golem.

Netherite Golem - The strongest, can Y E E T it's enemies higher than any other of the golems listed, can one-hit any mob with around 20 health (10 hearts, 1hp is half a heart in Minecraft), and also cannot be made the normal way a golem is made, instead, to make a Netherite Golem, you need to give a Diamond Golem a block of Netherite. This one is also the slowest golem listed.
So far, I think you can only get gold golems with the use of mods.
They are a good idea, though.
Along with iron golems, which already exist.
Redstone golem would give of redstone signal for mumbo jumbos video ideas
Just add the the more golems mod to normal Minecraft I play on PS4 so I don't have access to the mod as it is for only PC
more detail
Like the cooper ore?

I've often thought of this concept in Mines or maybe caves  -   

The character is an "Angry Miner" who can attack you with a pickaxe(even able to break through a block to get to you)  

Character could look like an old West prospector with a beard, brimmed hat and torn clothing.....If you give him something like bread or cooked meat he will become friendly and guide you to the nearest chest...
If fish were to reproduce, they wouldn‚Äôt despawn and it will drive up the water mob cap. You‚Äôll never see a squid again.
right now fish in a bucket is only good for aquariums if this update comes out it would give way more use for the fish mob but it should have its very own item i think like fish food
Yes, pretty nice idea for editing mob A.I.! I hope Mojang / Microsoft sees this!

Plus idea: the animals live in groups

- staying close to each other

- trying to maintain their population: if you (or somebody) kill one of them they copulate with each other

Also. There should be different breeds of the same animal. So like some aggressive cows like bulls and some attacking wolves who attack when your in its territory. That will add a good sense of survival and caution when approaching some animals.
And they should be faster than the player, make bowhunting a thing!
Smart, interesting idea!

I don‚Äôt think it should be controlled by the player.  Fish should just breed randomly with each other.  In order to breed to specific fish, you would have to contain them separate from any other fish.
Salmon would need a kind of waterfall to swim up to breed.
great! it can be used to make fishing farms.

The first step to breeding fish should be to get Plankton Water, which you would have a 25% chance of getting if you fill your bucket with water in the ocean. Plankton Water would look like regular water, but would look dirtier. Second, you need to place the plankton water somewhere. The minimum space for fish to be able to breed in plankton water should be a 1 x 1 block space, but one block down, so 1 x 1 x 2. Now you put two fish of the same type inside the plankton water, and after a while they should breed and create a pile of fish eggs below them in the water (this is why we need it to be 1 x 1 x 2, so there would be space for the eggs). After 10 minutes in real life, the eggs should hatch into 0-5 "baby" fish, which would eventually grow up. It will be rare to get 0 or 5 babies from one pile of eggs, uncommon for 1 or 4, but common for 2 or 3. Breeding salmon would be different, because right when salmon create the pile of salmon eggs, both salmon will die, but the eggs have a chance of creating 1-7 baby salmon.

I'm down for this because now that axolotls are coming. And I thought this: axolotls will be implemented as an endangered specie, so let's learn about their environment, their habits such as diet and behaviour, and how to breed them in order to repopulate them. So for this last thing, we're gonna need lots of tropical fishes, and not the dead ones that are easily obtainable from fishing, but the alive ones which spawn in the seas and are more tricky to catch (without mention that anyone needs to catch too many of them that way), but that may be a placing conditioner. So why not to breed all the fishes including the tropical ones and then using them for axolotls farms.

They need to allow tropical fish to breed for convenience of main base for breading axolotl. The pain to relocate base to be closer to catch more fish sometimes way not ideal and rime consuming. This is a must need game play convenience. but also like to see pet cages too to transport pets like fox or panda since the leads break in air. or birds can't keep up!
We could breed them with sea weeds
yeah it could be a good idea

I‚Äôve been thinking about this for a while now. Since they made the various cat types, making the ocelot untamable. It would be cool to have more than just taming a wolf. Having the dogs appear in different biomes depending on their breed would be nice, too. Maybe they could add stuff like collars, food/water bowls, pet beds, etc. as well. Might be a stretch, but it sounds entirely possible to me.
Amazing!

(Mojang won't let me write my own idea about this so I'm posting it here. I guess it expands on this idea a bit more. This is for 1.20 btw)

Since this update has a theme of self-expression and creating your own stories and experiences, I think that it would be a perfect idea to add new dog breeds to the game. After all, it's been more than a decade since there's been a significant change to the original wolf, and I feel like our furry friend could use some new changes. For example, just like the cat, once you tame a wild wolf, it would have a chance to turn into a couple of new dog breeds. (Ex. Corgi, Golden Retriever, Saint Bernard, etc.) The classic dog that we know and love would still be around, but we would also have these new dogs as well. The dogs could maybe help with locating the new Suspicious Sand and Gravel Blocks, while also having new abilities. There could be a new item called the Breed Charm that could be found in structures, and you could attach it to a dogs collar, which could give it new abilities based on their breed. For example, Saint Bernards could dig players out of Powdered Snow if they fall in it, or Corgis could herd farm animals. To not make this too overpowered, you would have to feed the dog every once in a while. Me and many others would love to have this in the game.

I'm on Board entirely, tan chihuahua Breeds Please.  

I Wish you the best of Luck on this idea.
good idea

Perhaps some beaches could be just stone and have Marine Iguanas that just into the ocean if the player or a predator gets near them.

The desert should have snakes(armless lizards) that won't hunt, but will bite at animals or the player that comes near.
Chameleons could scare spiders and other arthropods away
Please add a frilled lizard! Can you make them tamable too?!
Yes and attack spiders, silverfish, and endermites tamable with spiders eye
bearded dragons and komodo dragons should be in it too

  1. Jungles
  2. Deserts
  3. Badlands aka Mesa
  4. Beaches
  5. Forests
  6. Plains

(All biome variants included)

Also MAKE THEM TAMEABALE!!!
maybe the lizard can climb walls and when the lizard drops its tail you can combine it with an akward potion in a brewing stand to get a potion of wall climbing which lets you climb walls
